subject: AI
title: Underfitting
description: When your model is too simple to capture the pattern.

hook.text: You trained a model and it's bad at everything â€” training data, test data, all of it. It's not lazy; it's too simple.

buildup.text: Underfitting happens when the model doesn't have enough capacity (parameters, layers, features) to capture the real pattern in the data.

discovery.text: Fitting a straight line through data that's clearly curved is textbook underfitting. The model can't bend enough to match reality.

twist.text: Sometimes underfitting isn't the model's fault â€” it's bad features. If you feed a house-price model only the house color, no architecture will save it.

climax.text: Fix underfitting by adding relevant features, using a more expressive model, or training longer. If train accuracy is low, you haven't even memorized â€” let alone learned.

punchline.text: A model that can't fit training data has nothing useful to generalize.

quiz.question: What causes underfitting?
options: A model too complex for the task
A model too simple to capture the pattern
Too many features in the data
